intro: Lasiosiphon pubescens var. carinatus, commonly known as the hairy lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
